Items.Definition: To take care of someone or something.
Items.Example: She looks after her younger brother when their parents are at work.

Items.Definition: To collect someone or something; or to learn something without formal study.
Items.Example: I will pick you up at the station at 7 p.m.

Items.Definition: To have no more of something left.
Items.Example: We ran out of paper, so we cannot print the report.
Please carry on with your work while I talk to the manager.

Items.Definition: To have a friendly relationship with someone.
Items.Example: He gets along well with most of his coworkers.

Items.Definition: To refuse an offer or request.
Items.Example: She turned down the job offer because the salary was too low.

Items.Definition: To reach the same level or standard as someone or something.
Items.Example: After being sick, he worked hard to catch up with the rest of the class.
We need to figure out why the system crashed.

Items.Definition: To delay doing something until a later time.
Items.Example: They decided to put off the meeting until next week.

Items.Definition: To stop working (for a machine) or to become very upset emotionally.
Items.Example: The car broke down on the way to the airport.
